comments:
While smoke testing R2.0-I-I200612011533, recieved following exception when VPD was opening after creation of new JSP page.

Workaround requires closing the VPD and opening the JSP page with SSE JSP editor.

java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.eclipse.jst.pagedesigner.editors.HTMLEditor
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findClass(BundleLoader.java:402)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findClass(BundleLoader.java:347)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.internal.baseadaptor.DefaultClassLoader.loadClass(DefaultClassLoader.java:83)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.loadClass(BundleLoader.java:278)
<snip>
Please verify in a build later than 2006/12/05.

(In reply to comment #1)
> Please verify in a build later than 2006/12/05.

Ian,
Where should I get the build from?  I've encountered the issue as well with the patch2 that was attached to the original contribution.  The plugin works fine in hosted mode, but when you export the plugins and run directly the ClassNotFoundException for the HTMLEditor results.

What is the repository path?

Also, are there any more details on this issue as it is currently marked "resolved fixed"?

Thanks,
John

(In reply to comment #2)

> Ian,
> Where should I get the build from?  I've encountered the issue as well with the
> patch2 that was attached to the original contribution.  The plugin works fine
> in hosted mode, but when you export the plugins and run directly the
> ClassNotFoundException for the HTMLEditor results.

I am told, "It should be available on Friday(12/8) from the WTP declared weekly Integration build page."

> What is the repository path?

JSF files are in CVS at /cvsroot/webtools/org.eclipse.jsf.

> Also, are there any more details on this issue as it is currently marked
> "resolved fixed"?

There were plugin packaging issues with the "org.eclipse.jst.pagedesigner*" plugins, such that bundle classloaders could not find the files at runtime when they were installed as plugins (rather than being hosted in a runtime workspace).

I believe that the bug is correctly marked "FIXED" at this time. The reporter or one of his colleagues must now wait for the next integration build in order to test the fix, at which time the bug will be marked "VERIFIED" or reopened.
